qas.question: What cultures architecture inspired Islamic architecture to use pointed arch's?
When was Islamic architecture first seen?
In addition to forms from the ancient Middle East, what other place's forms had an effect on Islamic architecture?
What other parts of the society's needs did architecture fill?
What kind of arch design from Islamic architecture affected European architects?

context: Islamic architecture began in the <a1_0>7th century CE<a1_0/>, incorporating architectural forms from the ancient Middle East and <a2_0>Byzantium<a2_0/>, but also developing features to suit the <a3_0>religious and social needs<a3_0/> of the society. Examples can be found throughout the Middle East, North Africa, Spain and the Indian Sub-continent. The widespread application of the <a4_0>pointed arch<a4_0/> was to influence <a0_0>European architecture<a0_0/> of the Medieval period.
